channel.title: Photo of the Day
channel.description: Photo of the Day - Made with love by RSSHub(https://github.com/DIYgod/RSSHub)

item.title: Bike Lines
item.description:
Rows of bikes line a parking lot in downtown Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. The June 1965 issue profiled civilian life in the city—then known as Saigon—during the Vietnam War, calling it the "eye of the storm."
越南胡志明市市中心的一个停车场排成一排的自行车。1965年6月的一期报道了越战期间西贡的平民生活，称之为“风暴眼”
item.author: Wilbur Garrett, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Spiritual Leader
item.description:
Caleen Sisk is the spiritual leader and tribal chief of the Winnemem-Wintu tribe near Mount Shasta, California. She is one of the last living speakers of the tribe's native language.
卡莱恩·希斯克是加利福尼亚州沙斯塔山附近的温尼姆温图部落的精神领袖和部落首领。她是最后一个会说部落母语的人。
item.author: Lynn Johnson, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Picking Cranberries
item.description:
A woman and her son pick cranberries for Thanksgiving dinner on uninhabited Manana Island off the coast of Maine. Cranberries are native to North America, and they've been made into sauce and served with wild game for hundreds of years.
在缅因州海岸外无人居住的玛纳纳岛上，一名妇女和她的儿子正在摘蔓越橘作为感恩节晚餐。蔓越莓原产于北美洲，数百年来，它们被制成酱汁和野生动物一起食用。
item.author: Amy Toensing, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Above the Clouds
item.description:
Indian spotted deer gaze across mist-filled valleys and cloud-veiled mountains from the royal deer park above Gangtok, Sikkim, a state in northeastern India. Sikkim is also home to Kangchenjunga, the third-highest mountain in the world.
印度东北部锡金邦甘托克（Gangtok）上方的皇家鹿园（royal deer park）上，印度梅花鹿凝视着云雾弥漫的山谷和云雾笼罩的群山。锡金也是世界第三高峰康辰戎加的故乡。
item.author: Stephanie Dinkins, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Royal Stage
item.description:
Actors perform Pygmalion at the Royal Opera in the Palace of Versailles in France. The ornate opera house was built in 1770, opening its doors as part of the wedding celebrations for the future Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette.
在法国凡尔赛宫的皇家歌剧院，演员们在表演皮格马利翁。这座华丽的歌剧院建于1770年，作为未来路易十六和玛丽·安托瓦内特婚礼庆祝活动的一部分，它敞开大门。
item.author: James L. Stanfield, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Flower Child
item.description:
Near Lake Itasy, Madagascar, a girl gathers wild yellow cosmos flowers. Ninety percent of the island country's wildlife isn't found anywhere else on earth.
在马达加斯加伊塔西湖附近，一个女孩正在采集野生的黄色宇宙花。这个岛国90%的野生动物在地球上其他地方都找不到。
item.author: Albert Moldvay, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Village School
item.description:
Children learn in a bare-bones schoolhouse in the remote village of Jangbi, Bhutan. When Bhutan became a constitutional monarchy in 2008, the government called for 120 schools to be built throughout the country.
孩子们在不丹偏远村庄简陋的学校学习。2008年不丹成为君主立宪制国家时，政府要求在全国各地修建120所学校。
item.author: Lynsey Addario, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Television Assembly
item.description:
A Zenith Electronics worker in Illinois assembles a television set in this image from the December 1953 issue. Zenith Electronics produced American-made TVs and radios until the 1990s, when it was purchased by LG.
伊利诺伊州的一名Zenith电子公司的工人在组装一台电视机，这张照片摄于1953年12月号。Zenith Electronics生产美国制造的电视和收音机，直到20世纪90年代被LG收购。
item.author: Willard Culver, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Rescued Elephant
item.description:
An elephant orphan greets schoolchildren visiting Tsavo East National Park, Kenya. At the park, elephants orphaned by poachers will spend years recovering until they can safely reintegrate into the wild.
肯尼亚，一名大象孤儿向参观察沃东部国家公园的学童致意。在公园里，被偷猎者遗弃的大象将花费数年的时间恢复，直到它们能够安全地重新融入野外。
item.author: Michael Nichols, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Les Charmettes
item.description:
The entire July 1989 issue was dedicated to France's bicentennial. Les Charmettes, pictured here, was a favorite retreat for philosopher Jean-Jacques Rousseau. Now, it's a historical landmark and museum.
1989年7月的整期杂志都是为了纪念法国200周年。这张照片中的夏尔梅茨是哲学家让·雅克·卢梭最喜欢的静修场所。现在，它是一个历史地标和博物馆。
item.author: James Stanfield, Nat Geo Image Collection
